com.bukola

Class NationalInsurance4

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bukola.NationalInsurance4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Taxable

    public class NationalInsurance4
extends java.lang.Object
implements Taxable
    Class for computing class 4 National Insurance. All results are rounded up using BigDecimal RoundingMode.HALF_UP.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • NationalInsurance4

        public NationalInsurance4(java.math.BigDecimal lowThreshold,
                          java.math.BigDecimal highThreshold)
        Class constructor.
        Parameters:
        lowThreshold - this is the minimum profit set before self-employed individuals start to pay 9% of their earnings
        highThreshold - this is the maximum profit limit set before they start to pay 9% of their earnings, or 2% if/when earnings are higher than this value.

      • calculate

        public void calculate(java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> profit)
        Calculates class 4 National Insurance due on each weekly profit using the thresholds entered during class initialization. Nine percent is applied to total earnings that are equal to the lower threshold and less than or equal to the higher threshold. Two percent is applied to total earning that are higher than the high threshold. Computations are applied to weekly earnings after getting a total of earnings till date. Soon as total earnings meet one of the thresholds, class 4 National Insurance become deductible. But while earnings are below the minimum, no National Insurance 4 is deducted.
        Specified by:
        calculate in interface Taxable
        Parameters:
        profit - this is taxable income after expenses.
        See Also:
        Profits

      • applyNI4

        public void applyNI4(java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> weeklyPayList,
                     java.math.BigDecimal percentage)
        This applies National Insurance class 4 regardless of whether or not the earnings reach the thresholds. It is a convenience method that can be used in situations where the total annual earnings is already known beforehand and the appropriate NI4 percentage can be entered.
        Parameters:
        weeklyPayList - this is the list of earnings recorded to date.
        percentage - this is the appropriate NI4 percentage to be applied. Visit www.gov.uk for actual percentages. But this is usually 9% of total earnings if equal to or above the minimum threshold, and 2% of total earnings if above the maximum threshold.
        See Also:
        Profits

      • getList

        public java.util.List<java.math.BigDecimal> getList()
        Returns a list of all NI4 deductions due for each week's earnings.
        Specified by:

      • getTotalToDate

        public java.math.BigDecimal getTotalToDate()
        Returns a running total of all weekly NI4 calculations to date. This can be used to compute the total annual NI4 over a 52 week period, using the tax calendar.
        Specified by:
        getTotalToDate in interface Taxable
        Returns:
        a running total of NI4 calculations.
